intro: Syngonanthus spongiosus, commonly known as the spongey grass, is a perennial grass species native to South America. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
